intro: Lythrum dubium, commonly known as the lesser loosestrife, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Lythraceae family, which includes other flowering plants such as the poinsettia. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Its showy pink to purple flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. The plant is often found in wetlands, ditches, and moist meadows, thriving in damp, sunny conditions.
